bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to George L. Rives, July 25, 1888
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, July 25th, 1888.
Mr Ezekiel E. Smith to the Assistant Secretary of State.
Designating physician to examine J. R. Newby as applicant for pension & c.
Consulate Gen'l of the United States Monrovia, July 25th, 1888
Mr Ezekiel E. Smith to the Assistant Secretary of State.
Designating physician to examine Jas. R. Newby

Sir: I have the honor repsectfully to inform the Department that, in compliance with the insturction contained in yours of the 8th of June, I have designated the J. Henry Roberts M. D., who is the leading physician of Monrovia, to examine Mer. Jas. R. Newby. Dr. Roberts having been informed of the same, he has signified his willingness to perform said examination. The papers appertaining thereto have been handed him. Mer. Newby has been requested or notified to present himself to said Dr. Roberts for examination.
I have the honor to be, sir, your obedient servant
Ezek. E. Smith U.S. Consul Gen'l
To Hon. G. R. Rives Ass Secty of State.
